me.timothy.bots

Class LoansBotUtils

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.timothy.bots.LoansBotUtils

  • public class LoansBotUtils
extends java.lang.Object
    Contains various utility static methods that are necessary for the loans bot.
    Author:
    Timothy

      • formatInterval

        public static java.lang.String formatInterval(long l)
        Format the interval in milliseconds to hours, minutes, seconds, and milliseconds
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the formatted version

      • getLoansString

        public static java.lang.String getLoansString(java.util.List<Loan> loans,
                                              LoansDatabase db,
                                              java.lang.String relevantUser,
                                              me.timothy.bots.FileConfiguration config)
        Gets a string that represents the specified loan such that it is readily readable. If there are less than 5 loans this is equivalent to getLoansStringRaw, otherwise it matches config.getCheckTruncated
        Parameters:
        loans - the loans
        db - the database
        relevantUser - the relevant user in the loans (required for truncating)
        config - the configuration options to use
        Returns:
        a string representing a human-readable version of the list of loans. Potentially truncated

      • getLoansAsTable

        public static java.lang.String getLoansAsTable(java.util.List<Loan> loans,
                                               LoansDatabase db,
                                               int max)
        Sorts the specified list of loans according to their date (newest first), and adds a little note at the bottom if any loans are truncated
        Parameters:
        loans - the loans to stringify
        db - the database to use if additional information is needed
        max - the maximum loans before truncation
        Returns:
        the loans as a table

      • getUsernamesSeperatedWith

        public static java.lang.String getUsernamesSeperatedWith(User user,
                                                         LoansDatabase db,
                                                         java.lang.String seperator)

        Fetches the username of the specified user and returns them seperated with the specified string.

        Ex. if the user had the username Bob and no other usernames, and this was called with the seperator " / ", then the result would be Bob

        Ex. if the username had the usernames Bob and Alice and no other usernames, and this was called with the seperator " / ", then the result would be Bob / Alice

        Parameters:
        user - the user to fetch usernames of
        db - the database to use to fetch the usernames
        seperator - the seperator between usernames
        Returns:
        the usernames seperated with the specified seperator
